column4: Hey i have a problem when i removed a UBUNTU harddrive from one machine and put it in another machine to boot

when i put a existing harddrive with ubuntu 7.10 installed into another box and booted it would boot find till it got to running local scrips it would just stay there and not move further in the boot. Should i reconfigure xorg?
fine^ not find
edit your /etc/fstab and comment# out the drive that doesn't exist any more
ok. first lets see how you are set. touch /tmp/test
does that create a new file in the /tmp dir?
ok, you are prolly mounted in read-only mode
you need to mount your shit rw to fix this
hang with me, I'll tell you :)
mount -o remount, rw /
I will keep that in mind, I won't lead you in the wrong way
mount -o remount, rw /
that should remount your disk in read-write mode
now touch /tmp/test again
$> touch /tmp/test
"$>" is your prompt
$>  ls -l /tmp/test
if it gives you info, that is good just tell me
excellent! now do $> vim /etc/fstab
on now you need to /query AAA and paste all that into private chat, and I'll help you
look at your new chat window
